docs.lead_paragraph: The number of couples who live together out of wedlock, often with children, is increasing rapidly, a new study reports. The study, by a sociologist at the Institute for Social Research at the University of Michigan, reports that about two in five children will spend at least some time living with their mother and her unmarried partner. Less often, children will live with their father and his partner.
docs.abstract: Number of couples who live together out of wedlock, often with children, is increasing rapidly; about two in five children will spend at least some time living with their mother and her unmarried partner; less often children will live with their father and his partner; graph (M)
